alert.note: Alert for Greene; Lenoir; Pitt (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 7:39PM EST until December 23 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Contentnea Creek Near Hookerton affecting Lenoir, Pitt and Greene Counties. For the Contentnea Creek...including Hookerton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Contentnea Creek near Hookerton. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor flooding of low lying areas adjacent to creek can be expected. Several homes threatened by water in northwest Greene County near HWY 58. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EST Wednesday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps. The next statement will be issued by Thursday morning at 1000 AM EST.
